Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Isl978
Reviews.Content: Attention: this place used to be apartments it's really old. I made a reservation online and the price was totally different from what they were giving me over the phone. The Indian guy said it was a "walk-in" price (more expensive than the one online) I made the reservation online but the staff over the phone sounded really rude. There is no parking in the back. I had to park my car in front of the building. Inside the room the fridge didn't work properly (it was in max) and it could barely cold down the food. Your neighbors (you can smell the drugs) not a good place to stay. We payed 118 total price. Wifi is extremely slow (feels like you are surfing the Internet on a phone line) really slow. I could barely load a YouTube video.

Reviews.Title: “Land of the Zombies”
Reviews.Author: duboce
Reviews.Content: I always like to read the other reviews before posting my own to make sure we are writing about the same place because some of the reports are so glowing that I would liike to meet the other reviewers to make sure they are real. We stayed at the studio 6 with advance reservations for 4 nights. The price was high for this sort of place and we paid $20 a night extra because we had 2 dogs and the charge is $10 per might per dog. This brought the total cost up high for this kind of place. Upon arrival in the afternoon, had we been able to do so, we would have kept driving and found a better place closer in to Burbank. This area is crummy and walking the dogs around showed more barbed wire and spiked fences including the motel itself than might be found at Folsom Prison.There are lots of hoody type people hanging around on the corners and night time has a lot of wild traffic activity. Points to consider: the room was okay, a bit worn out, the kitchen was okay but lacking in items. The bathroom was spotless but no counter for toiletries, only the limited part of the sink. The towels and bath mat-- I use better stuff to wash my car. The cheapest linens available were used, maybe Chinese rejects? The t.v. was good, plenty of cable stations but no instructions for the more complicated procedures which caused a problem. the wi fi internet is among the best, fast, swift, easy on line. we even watched a netflix movie through the laptop which proves it was high quality connection. The managers were okay, there is not too much to ask of them. The pool is in the center and unusued due to the cool weather. Its generally a small place with 2 wings, a laundry room. The parking lot is the nightmare area. Spaces are tight and many guests had big trucks and suv's probably because they had pets or children and it was tight terrible parking. We parked a pickup truck with great difficulty and wanted to avoid leaving it on the street due to the area. The first two nights there was a man lurking in the parking lot, smoking. I found out later he was a long term guest. While parking one night, trying to get into a tight spot, we bumped his front bumper. There was no damage to either vehicle. He got argumentative and would not let up saying that his junker 95 nissan pathfinder was damaged. He kept it up and I called the police who arrived in 10 minutes and defused the situation. We checked out the next morning and got a refund for the 4th night. Judge for yourself if you want to stay here. Sad to say, we find Motel 6 generally patronized by crummy people. Many motel 6's are in uncrowded locations which makes them a good place to stay especially on highways. In cities though, they are more like hot sheet places with guests coming in and out for a quickie. They allow pets which is the primary reason we stay there. I know that the company is at the mercy of the guests that are greatly varied. But think carefully before you stay here. The place was clean and the maid service was fine but the value and safety were questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pelican2770
Reviews.Content: This property is meticulously maintained and absolutely spotless. Our first stay there was several months ago and found it wonderful then so we went back. At first I was skeptical because it is marketed as "interim housing" and I was picturing all sorts of unpleasant things. How wrong I was. The Sudio 6 branch of the Motel 6 chain caters to extended stays by offering full kitchens in the units. This really helps save money by being able to cook meals there. A weekly stay is only $55 per night, a great value for this centrally located San Fernando Valley (the Valley) property. The rooms are spotless, the appliances are good quality, the air conditioning works well (it was over 100 during our last stay), the WiFi is fast and reliable and the pool is fresh and clean. There is adequate off street parking and the grounds are kept exceptionally clean. The other guests were very friendly and I felt safe. I highly recommend this property for those looking to stay several days in the LA/Hollywood/Valley area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but the staff is incredibly rude and no customer service”
Reviews.Author: professionalnomad247
Reviews.Content: You can get a much nicer extended stay room for $55 to $60 a night in a much nicer area. This place is great if you need to be in Van Nuys area, and the rooms are spacious and fairly clean, but it's a very bad area outside the hotel, definitely not a female or family friendly area. If they dropped the price just a little and hired some friendly people, I would stay here or even recommend to someon else.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicc2
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Staff was rude and behind bullet proof glass. Terrible neighborhood, room was located facing Sherman way. Hookers live there along with others, this is more of a dirty apartment complex than a hotel! The pictures on the website was not the same hotel, they lied. Dirty rooms, the amenities listed on the website were not what the hotel had. Horrible experience and would NEVER again stay or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Klc0472
Reviews.Content: Checked in yesterday. Area isn't as bad as I expected. Parking in a back lot semi gated but fills up at night. Cute courtyard with a clean pool. Room is decent with ours having a kitchen. Definitely a good value and just about the cheapest I found with a kitchen and king sizes bed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: pelican2770
Reviews.Content: I go to California to visit my daughter and like to stay a couple of weeks. The San Fernando valley is an expensive place so I was happy to find this motel because of the kitchenette. The area looks scary but once I was inside the courtyard it was fine. The room was very clean and the facilities were good. WiFi worked great, TV was good. All that was missing was a toaster. For longer term stays I think this is a good value (ask for the weekly rates).

Reviews.Title: “Not a comfortable neighborhood; inside of courtyard much better.”
Reviews.Author: dallas12345
Reviews.Content: We skimped to save a few dollars when we went to LA. The neighborhood around the hotel is not good. We got out of the car and saw this guy watching us from the balcony of an apartment next door to this property. That was a little creepy. Once you get inside the courtyard of the hotel, it looks nice enough. We slept OK and didn't notice any bugs. It seemed fairly clean. I wouldn't stay there again just because I didn't feel completely comfortable and would rather pay a little more to stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “extended stay, stay extended stay america”
Reviews.Author: travelwoo
Reviews.Content: mattress is very nice compaired to extended stay america. somethings very clean and new others dirty and old. the room did not have a fully equipped kiction, and we brought a lot of food to find a fridge and a microwave no dishes/ sink /stove and a VERY old scary microwave. also the TV did not work right the, the internet (im on now) was givin wrong codes first (just annoying) and the room smells like gas, i cant figure out where from but certain spots smell of it worse than others. the front dest will not switch me rooms i have a very bad head ache now. im waiting for my boyfriend to come back. my advice was leave the door open..... but its not in a great area (central for where we need to be but bad area) im alone and 8 1/2 months pregnant. not great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and rather quiet”
Reviews.Author: Toda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple but clean. The reception was friendly. I can recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than it looks!”
Reviews.Author: geg0004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night while attending the AFI Film Festival in LA.. As out of towners, we were a bit unsure of the hotel, as it is in an okay, but a little rough around the edges, part of town. Anyway, the hotel has a gated parking lot, which really helps add to the security, and it has a cute little interior courtyard overlooking a swimming pool. It isn't a luxury hotel by any means, but it was clean, quiet, and I felt quite safe the whole trip. It is a family run hotel and the staff was very helpful to us. Overall, I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “worst place I ever stayed---stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I ever stayed. Unfortunatly I made the reservation over the phone the night before so I was told I wouldn't get a refund if I cancelled. I didn't worry about that since I had stayed at a Best Value Inn in Williams, Az and it was great. When we got there we had to go down a dark alley to get to the office. There were people laying down in the parking area. We would have left except we had already paid. The hallways smelled like urine. The front desk person was eyeballing and trying to flirt with my daughter. The room was awful. The bathroom was dirty. We had to clean the toilet ourselves before we could use it. Neither one of use was brave enough to step foot in the shower. We wore our shoes in the room and wore our clothes to bed as we were afraid of what might have been in it. There were signs all over the place warning about illegal drug use and prostitues as well as a sign saying you had to pay for the whole night and not just an hour. You had to put a $10 deposit to use the phone and they deducted 52 cents a minute from it for local calls. We left there as quick as we could in the morning. I have stayed in a lot of motels as I like to travel but none of them ever made me feel like I needed a shower after leaving them. After staying here I have started to read reviews before staying anywhere. I am happy to report the best value inn no longer has them listed as one of their motels.

HotelInfo.Name: Studio 6 Van Nuys
HotelInfo.Address: 13561 Sherman Way, I-170 & Sherman Way Exit, Los Angeles, CA 91405 (Formerly Suburban Extended Stay Van Nuys)
